intro: Brunfelsia cestroides, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Brunfelsia cestroides is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and unique flowering pattern.
